content.description: Start at the base of the prow/arÃªte feature. Utilize good sidepulls and crimps on either side to gain the tree. Hoist yourself up and enjoy the view. You might want a spotter, as this one's right over the drink!
content.location: Take the Smalley Falls trail to its end at the cascade. Descend down and right to a narrow path/rock hop. Find a prow-shaped rock with a thigh-thick sapling growing from the top. At first glance it looks like choss, not worth doing. But the rock is solid and the holds are good.

content.description: Specifically near Smalley Falls. Next to the cascade, there are short bands of rock that appears to be chossy and unclimbed. Lots of moss, spiderwebs, and day trippers. The ambience of the primordial trees and the thundering of the water more than makes up for this. I only climbed one line, but I saw 3 or 4 potential good boulder problems, though some had scary landings (ie IN the falls)
